Trial_Design.evidence: We randomly assigned 62 patients scheduled for total hip arthroplasty

Participants.evidence: 62 patients scheduled for total hip arthroplasty

Intervention.evidence: parecoxib 40 mg at induction, placebo at wound closure, and parecoxib 40 mg 12 hours after induction (pre); or, 3) placebo at induction, parecoxib 40 mg at wound closure, and parecoxib 40 mg 12 hours after induction (post)

Method_Outcome.evidence: Pain scores at rest and with movement recorded every 4 hours for 24 hours using a visual analog scale.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Morphine use in the Post Anesthesia Care Unit was reduced in the pre and post groups compared with the control group (14.2±2.0, and 15.7±2.0, versus 20.4±2.3 mg), although the trend was only significant (p < 0.05) in the pre group.

Harms.evidence: Treatment side effects were recorded every 4 hours.
